00009 //Default constructor
00010 StopFunctor::StopFunctor()
00011 {
00012     cacheValue = 0;
00013     functor = new Delta_Functor();
00014 }
00015 
00016 //Constructor. Pass in the start and end times for the function, as well as the beginning and ending values.
00017 //The exp value is a control over how it varies: if exp > 1, the functor starts slow and ends fast. If
00018 //0 < exp < 1, the functor starts fast and ends slow. exp = 1 is linear.
00019 StopFunctor::StopFunctor(int startTime, int endTime, double startValue, double endValue, double exp)
00020 {
00021     cacheValue = 0;
00022     functor = new Delta_Functor(startTime, endTime, startValue, endValue, exp);
00023 }
00024

00026 StopFunctor StopFunctor::addFunctor(const Delta_Functor toAdd)
00027 {
00028     functor->addFunctor(toAdd);
00029     return *this;
00030 }

00043 StopFunctor StopFunctor::operator +(const StopFunctor toAdd) {
00044     return addFunctor( *(toAdd.functor));

00090 StopFunctor StopFunctor::cat(const StopFunctor toCat)
00091 {
00092     //Move the time so that toCat's time begins when this functor ends

00110 //Returns the current value of the functor, based on the current time
00111 double StopFunctor::getValue()
00112 {
00113     if (cacheValue) {
00114         return cacheValue;
00115     }
00116     if (functor->isComplete()) {
00117         cacheValue = functor->getValue();
00118         //printf("%d", &(functor));
00119     }
00120     return functor->getValue();
